name: Rambu Solo
description: "Rambu Solo" is a traditional funeral ceremony for the Toraja tribe in Sulawesi, Indonesia. The funeral ceremony requires the family of the deceased to make a party as a sign of final respect for the deceased who has left. There is an interesting fact, this ceremony can cost hundreds of millions and even billions, for families who have not been able to carry out this ceremony, they can store the corpse and be preserved in the house, it can even take years, until they can carry out the ceremony, this painting shows family closeness even for those who have died, they can still feel at home, solidarity, sensitivity, and a high sense of compassion are noble values
